p: Recombinant plasmids containing a 450-bp fragment of the P1 gene (nt 180,858–185,741, GenBank accession no. U00089.2) were prepared. The primers used to construct the plasmid are listed in Table 2. The resulting PCR products from the P1 gene were cloned into a T-vector using the pGM-Simple-T-Kit (TIANGEN Biotech (Beijing) Co., China) to construct the recombinant plasmids. The plasmid DNA was quantified with a NanoDrop 2000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Dreieich, Germany). The DNA copy number was calculated using the following formula: DNA copy number (copy number/μL) = [6.02 × 10 23 × plasmid concentration (ng/μL) × 10 − 9]/[DNA length (nt) × 660] [ 14]. The constructed plasmids were verified by sequencing and stored at − 20°C until use.
